title: Breaking through the publishing glass ceiling: A tribute to my literary agent
description: Sheridan Prasso honors the late Elaine Markson, a trailblazing literary agent who championed women writers and helped shatter publishing's glass ceiling beginning in the 1970s.

title: Travel Essay: Hiking Huangshan helped me conquer the mountain within
description: Betty Xiao recounts her solo trek up China's Yellow Mountain, defying the doubts of loved ones to confront the fears and limits she carried within.

title: Female artists and writers reflect on feminist art and journalism
description: At a NüVoices panel in Beijing, artists Li Xinmo and Annabel Gueredrat join journalist Joanna Chiu to explore how feminism shapes their creative and reporting practices despite personal and professional risks.

title: Fiction Excerpt: Tender Darling
description: An American expat's apartment hunt in Shanghai becomes a sharp study in identity and belonging when her Shanghai-born British landlord declares she won't rent to Chinese tenants.

title: NüVoices Podcast #1: News assistants in China
description: The debut NüVoices podcast features hosts Alice Xin Liu and Joanna Chiu interviewing two Chinese women working as news assistants for foreign media, exploring the often-uncredited journalistic labor behind foreign correspondence in China.

title: NüVoices Podcast #2: China’s #MeToo momentum, with Yuan Yang
description: Yuan Yang of the Financial Times joins hosts Alice Xin Liu and Joanna Chiu to examine how #MeToo gained momentum in mainland China, navigating censorship and institutional pressure as the movement spread from universities to NGOs, media, and the arts.

title: NüVoices Podcast #3: Meet fantasy writer Mima, who aspires to create China’s Game of Thrones
description: Fantasy writer Mima (Qima 七马) discusses her novel The Legend of Strangers and her work scripting it into a web series for Youku, joined by new co-host Sophie Lu in this third NüVoices Podcast episode.

title: NüVoices Podcast #4: Technology and bias with Christina Larson
description: Christina Larson joins Alice and Sophie to explore technology and bias in China, from the social credit system to AI's gender biases, plus why reproductive burdens fall on women—and share self-care picks from calligraphy to bird science.

title: Shanghai NüVoices discussion salon
description: NüVoices launched its Shanghai discussion salon, where attendees shared experiences with workplace sexism and brainstormed actionable steps—from unconscious bias training to amplifying women's voices on expert panels.

title: NüVoices launches in Hong Kong
description: NüVoices, a collective amplifying women writers and artists focused on China, celebrated its Hong Kong launch with open discussion of gender representation in media and a growing directory of nearly 500 female experts.

title: Berlin Stammtisch: Launch of Europe's NüVoices network
description: NüVoices launched its European network at a Berlin Stammtisch, where members discussed improving China coverage, expanding expert lists, and exploring independent funding and storytelling formats beyond mainstream media.

title: A NüVoices gathering in Taipei
description: At NüVoices' inaugural Taipei gathering, journalists, artists, and activists explored the gap between Taiwan's progressive reputation and the persistent realities of gender inequality, assault taboos, and media invisibility.

title: Hong Kong's lesbian spaces and the stories behind them
description: Benita Chick navigates Hong Kong's hidden LGBTQ+ venues—secret bars tucked in revolutionary-era alleyways—to uncover the overlooked history of the city's lesbian spaces.

title: Five female Chinese artists explore femininity
description: Five female Chinese artists from across the diaspora challenge the art world's stark gender imbalance, using mediums from paper cutting to installation to explore the forces that shape women's lives.

title: Personal Essay by a Chinese-American: Distances
description: Huizhong Wu reflects on the quiet distances of a Chinese-American upbringing, finding refuge in friends' homes that mirrored the American life she longed to inhabit.

title: NüVoices community: October social gathering in Hong Kong
description: NüVoices hosted an informal community gathering in Hong Kong in October 2018, bringing together diverse voices to discuss #MeToo developments in China, female representation in sci-fi writing, and other pressing topics over food and drinks.

title: How to rock your broadcast appearance
description: Sophia Yan shares hard-won tips for navigating live and taped broadcast appearances, from earpiece etiquette to handling remote anchors, drawing on her own transition from print journalism to television.

title: Loud Murmurs: A feminist Chinese podcast deconstructing US pop culture
description: Afra Wang examines how US pop culture shaped a generation of Chinese youth and how Loud Murmurs, a feminist podcast, now deconstructs the values Hollywood exported unchallenged.

title: Personal Essay by a Chinese adoptee: I returned to China to find my biological family and discover my cultural roots
description: A Chinese adoptee raised in francophone Quebec traces her journey back to China to search for her biological family, navigating the complex space between her Western identity and Chinese heritage.

title: NüVoices Podcast #5: Joan Xu on screenwriting in China
description: Screenwriter Joan Xu discusses her work on China-Hollywood co-productions and web series from her base in Beijing, while the NüVoices team announces the launch of their revamped website and NüStories online magazine.

title: NüVoices launches in New York November 1!
description: NüVoices, the international editorial collective amplifying women's voices on China, announces its first North American chapter launch in New York, featuring a panel on contemporary feminist organizing with Leta Hong Fincher, Rebecca Karl, and Lu Pin.

title: Translation: Reflections on #MeToo and machismo violence by Peruvian writer Gabriela Wiener
description: Translator Isolda Morillo presents Peruvian writer Gabriela Wiener's sharp reflections on #MeToo and machismo violence, connecting feminist voices from Latin America to China in a global reckoning with patriarchy.

title: NüVoices Podcast #6: Oral histories and family stories with Karoline Kan
description: Karoline Kan joins the NüVoices podcast to discuss oral histories, family storytelling, and her debut memoir "Under Red Skies," alongside reflections on the personal essay genre and navigating a book deal.

title: Fiction Excerpt: Searching for Gao Meng
description: Dana Liu's fiction excerpt follows a Western scholar in Nanjing who becomes consumed by the story of Ding Ling, a censored female writer whose defiance of Mao's cultural regime mirrors the narrator's own search for intellectual freedom.

title: Madeleine O'Dea on her memoir The Phoenix Years, Chinese artists and the nation's transformation
description: Joanna Chiu speaks with foreign correspondent Madeleine O'Dea about The Phoenix Years, her memoir tracing China's dramatic transformation through nine artists caught between creativity and state control.

title: NüVoices Podcast #7: A rocket maker turned journalist, Lijia Zhang
description: From rocket factory worker to award-winning author, Lijia Zhang shares her remarkable journey and her mission to amplify the voices of China's marginalized "little people" through powerful literary storytelling.

title: Social: NüVoices London Dinner/Drinks
description: NüVoices London hosted an informal dinner and drinks social, inviting those passionate about China to connect, discuss current topics, and explore collaboration opportunities including plans for an upcoming women's panel launch event.

title: 100+ attend NüVoices NYC launch and discussion on Chinese feminism
description: Over 100 people packed Verso Books for NüVoices NYC's launch, where panelists Leta Hong Fincher, Rebecca Karl, and Lü Pin explored the rise of feminist organizing in Xi Jinping's China.

title: NüVoices Podcast #8: Eleanor Goodman on the art of translating Chinese poetry
description: Translator and Harvard research associate Eleanor Goodman discusses her work bringing Chinese poetry into English, including her translation of Wang Xiaoni and the workers' poetry anthology Iron Moon, in this conversation with hosts Alice Xin Liu and Lijia Zhang.

title: Community: A NüVoices gathering in London
description: NüVoices held its first London gathering, drawing over 25 China watchers, academics, and activists for an evening of discussion on gender, media representation, and the #MeToo movement in China.

title: NüVoices Podcast #9: Long-Form Magazine Writing With The New Yorker’s Jiayang Fan
description: New Yorker staff writer Jiayang Fan joins from Brooklyn to discuss her immigrant journey, the craft of long-form magazine writing, and carving space for Asian-American voices in literary journalism.

title: NüVoices Podcast #10: All-female improv group "Beijing Broads"
description: The NüVoices Podcast sits down with Anete and Silvia of Beijing Broads, an all-female improv troupe spanning seven countries, to discuss comedy for women in China, building onstage confidence, and their work supporting girls' education in rural China.

title: Personal Essay by a Chinese daughter: The half-truths we tell in times of sickness
description: Wang Zhen recounts how her family, separated by continents, wove a fragile web of half-truths around her mother's grade three brain cancer diagnosis—a collective act of love to shield her from the weight of her prognosis.

title: Short Story from a Queer Woman: Tearing
description: Alice Xin Liu chronicles a married woman's intoxicating fall for another woman through a cascade of WeChat pings, mapping queer desire, delusion, and the temporary insanity of love.

title: Opinion: Why women are leaving Hong Kong tech companies
description: Athena Lam examines why women are leaving Hong Kong's tech industry, exploring the structural barriers, pay gaps, and glass ceilings driving a quiet exodus from the city's companies.

title: NüYear Drinks in DC - Welcome NüVoices to the US Capital!
description: NüVoices launched its Washington, D.C. chapter with a Lunar New Year gathering at Petworth Citizen & Reading Room, hosted by editorial chair Joanna Chiu and local coordinator Anne Henochowicz.

title: NüVoices and YCW London invites you to our China careers wanel
description: NüVoices and Young China Watchers London bring together three experts from media, academia and government to discuss building China-related careers and advancing gender equity in the workplace.

title: NüVoices of the Diaspora: An evening of storytelling in NYC
description: NüVoices of the Diaspora brings together artists Muna Tseng, Alvin Eng, Karoline Kan, and Angel Yau for an evening of readings, spoken word, and performance art exploring Asian American and Chinese diaspora experiences at MOCA in New York City.

title: Meet the queer women organizers of Shanghai's LGBTQ community
description: Four queer women stand at the heart of Shanghai's LGBTQ scene, building spaces for visibility and community—starting with the city's first lesbian bar.

title: Women experts discuss gender issues and how to build successful China-related careers in London Wanel
description: Three women experts in media, academia, and consulting share their China-related career journeys and discuss gender issues at a NüVoices London panel co-hosted with Young China Watchers to kick off the Year of the Pig.

title: NüVoices invites you to our London Launch Wanel "Being feminist in China: Gender issues across generations"
description: NüVoices launches in London with a panel exploring feminism in China across generations, examining how capitalist reforms, the #MeToo movement, and tightened censorship have reshaped gender activism in mainland China and Hong Kong.

title: NüVoices DC Event: Life under Chinese Rule in Xinjiang
description: Zubayra Shamseden and Irade Kashgary share firsthand accounts of growing up Uyghur under Chinese rule, as NüVoices DC examines the ongoing crisis of mass detention and cultural erasure in Xinjiang.

title: WATCH: Over 80 attend NüVoices London launch wanel "Being feminist in China: Gender issues across generations"
description: A sold-out crowd of over 80 gathered at SOAS for NüVoices' London launch, where activists and journalists explored feminism in China across generations—from personal family histories to the #MeToo movement.

title: Q&A with NüVoices board member Karoline Kan, author of Under Red Skies
description: Former NYT reporter and NüVoices board member Karoline Kan discusses her debut memoir, the first English-language account by a Chinese millennial, weaving three generations of women's stories against China's turbulent modern history.

title: DC Event recap: Uyghur women on the ongoing human rights crisis in their homeland
description: NüVoices DC's inaugural panel brought together two Uyghur women and an ethnomusicologist to discuss the ongoing human rights crisis, highlighting cases of political prisoners and the diaspora community's efforts to preserve cultural identity.

title: NüVoices Podcast #11: Queer culture, perception, and representation within China, with Alex Li
description: Alex Li, senior editor at Vice China and host of the Biede Girls channel, joins to discuss queer culture, bisexuality, and LGBTQ+ representation in Chinese media, from Chris Lee to fan fiction's "shipping" phenomenon.

title: NüVoices London wanel ft. board member Karoline Kan, author of Under Red Skies
description: NüVoices and Young China Watchers London co-host a panel with Karoline Kan discussing her memoir "Under Red Skies," the first English-language account of Chinese millennial life told through three generations of her family.

title: Event Recap: NüVoices' Hong Kong chapter talks #MeToo and LGBT issues in China
description: NüVoices' Hong Kong chapter convened twelve professionals from law, media, academia, and NGOs for an open discussion on the #MeToo movement's impact in China and Hong Kong, as well as LGBT issues and the role of technology in government surveillance.

title: NüVoices Podcast #12: Shui, on Beijing's 'zine scene
description: Comic artist Shui discusses cofounding Beijing's Hole in the Wall Collective, her indie zine work with Jinna Kaneko, and an artistic style shaped by Old Master Q and a life split between Tokyo, Beijing, and London.

title: NüVoices Podcast #13: ‘Black Mirror’ China and Dystopian Female Futures with Cate Cadell
description: Cate Cadell joins the NüVoices podcast to discuss China's surveillance state and its impact on women, from government data collection on "breeding" status to dystopian tech futures shaped by AI, CRISPR, and censorship.

title: NüVoices Podcast #14: Women and Chinese Sci-Fi: Live at the Bookworm with Tang Fei and Ji Shaoting
description: Tang Fei and Ji Shaoting join NüVoices live at the Beijing Bookworm Literary Festival to discuss the challenges facing female Chinese sci-fi writers, from gender discrimination to expanding the market for Chinese science fiction.

title: NüVoices Podcast #15: Rocking while female, with Anlin Fan of Xiao Wang (小王)
description: Anlin Fan of Chinese punk band Xiao Wang discusses the Riot Grrrl movement, feminism and intersectionality, and her work empowering young musicians through Rock Camp for Girls in Montreal.

title: Carving out Chinese ideals of female beauty: Visualizations by Artist Su Yang
description: Feminist artist Su Yang uses exaggerated large-scale self-portraits to challenge China's booming cosmetic surgery industry and the patriarchal beauty standards driving millions of women under the knife.

title: Five podcasts on LGBTQ+ culture in Greater China
description: Athena Lam spotlights five podcasts from Taiwan, Hong Kong, and Mainland China that amplify queer women, trans, and non-binary voices often overlooked in mainstream LGBTQ+ representation across Greater China.

title: Overseas Chinese reflect on China's #MeToo Movement from the United States
description: Chinese students and professionals in the U.S. reflect on the challenges facing China's #MeToo movement, sharing perspectives on sexual harassment, government censorship, and the slow but growing push for gender equality.

title: Taiwan's lesbian sex toy and divination shop strives to help queer women accept themselves
description: Inside Love Boat, a Taipei shop pairing I-Ching divination with sex toys and community since 2004, queer women find a rare haven for spiritual exploration and self-acceptance.

title: NüVoices DC Event: Gelato Social & Museum Hop
description: NüVoices DC invited members to a summer social at the Hirshhorn Museum for gelato, followed by a guided tour of the "Empresses of China's Forbidden City" exhibit at the Freer & Sackler Galleries.

title: Making it personal: A life writing workshop with Madeleine O’Dea in London
description: Author and veteran journalist Madeleine O'Dea hosts a free London workshop on the craft of life writing, drawing on three decades of experience and lessons from her own memoir-writing journey.

title: Full house of 70+ welcome board member and author Karoline Kan at London wanel
description: A packed audience of over 70 gathered at King's College London as NüVoices and Young China Watchers welcomed board member Karoline Kan to discuss her debut memoir, Under Red Skies, exploring three generations of life in a rapidly transforming China.

title: Fiction: A brother comes to visit
description: Jessie Tu's sharp, intimate fiction traces a woman's restless hunger for more—and the self-judgment that never quiets—through a brother's visit and dumplings shared on a bitter winter night.

title: NüVoices Podcast #17: Legal advocacy against domestic violence in China, with Siodhbhra Parkin
description: Siodhbhra Parkin joins host Joanna Chiu to discuss her legal advocacy work against domestic violence in China, the impact of new NGO regulations, and the ongoing fight to support Chinese rule of law activists.

title: James Griffiths, author of The Great Firewall of China, discusses censorship and China's women's movement
description: James Griffiths, author of The Great Firewall of China, examines how state censorship undermines feminist solidarity in China and the creative tactics activists use to fight back.

title: 10 Tips for writing life stories from Madeleine O'Dea, author of The Phoenix Years
description: Madeleine O'Dea, author of The Phoenix Years, distills her memoir-writing experience into ten practical tips for finding the vivid details that make readers truly care.

title: Q&A: Young women discuss gender and education in China today
description: Young Chinese women discuss the stark urban-rural divide in gender and education, where rising university enrollment coexists with deep-rooted barriers in rural communities.

title: B人BEL Magazine Call for Submissions
description: B人BEL Magazine opens submissions for its second issue, seeking written, photographic, and illustrated stories highlighting underrepresented communities in China, with an August 31 deadline.

title: Event Recap: Lü Pin on the Chinese feminist movement's strategies in China and the US
description: NüVoices DC members met with activist Lü Pin to discuss the Chinese feminist movement's tactics for combating domestic abuse, workplace harassment, and censorship both online and offline in China and the US.

title: “Your Mother Sacrificed Herself for the Country” – The Idealization of the Female Martyr in China
description: Emily Matson examines how Zhao Yiman, one of China's most lionized female revolutionary martyrs, became an enduring symbol of sacrifice — and how the CCP's idealization of women as faithful mothers and soldiers shapes national memory.

title: Sinobabble Podcast Call for Guest Speakers
description: Sinobabble, a Hong Kong-based podcast exploring China's history, politics, and culture, is seeking guest speakers with expertise in any facet of Chinese society to join host Edi for upcoming episodes.

title: THEATRE: Chinese creators present "No Foreigners," a show using shopping malls as a portal for telling Chinese diaspora stories
description: Chinese diaspora creators in Toronto explore North American Chinese shopping malls as sites of cultural memory and collision in "No Foreigners," a multimedia performance weaving Cantonese and English across past, present, and afterlife.

title: OPEN CALL: Seeking HK-based Artist for residency at the Centre for Chinese Contemporary Art in Manchester, UK
description: The British Council Hong Kong and the Centre for Chinese Contemporary Art invite Hong Kong-based artists to apply for a fully funded, nine-week residency in Manchester focused on socially engaged practice.

title: NüVoices Podcast #16: The musical life and career of director Zou Shuang (邹爽)
description: Director and Beijing Music Festival artistic director Zou Shuang discusses her path from a musical household to adapting European opera for Chinese audiences, her 2019 International Opera Awards nomination, and life working across the U.K. and China.

title: NüVoices Podcast #18: Cultivating community in corporate culture, with Chenni Xu
description: Chenni Xu, corporate communications head for Alipay in North America, shares insights on navigating corporate culture, building peer networks, finding mentorship, and claiming your seat at the table.

title: Call for nominations: Young China Watcher of the Year Award
description: Young China Watchers announces its second annual Young China Watcher of the Year Award, seeking nominations for young professionals making extraordinary contributions to the global understanding of China across politics, business, academia, and civil society.

title: Navigating my biracial identity as a Chinese-American living in China
description: Megan Cattel explores the paradox of being biracial Chinese-American—seen as Asian in the U.S. and white in China—and how moving to Shanghai became both an escape and a deeper reckoning with identity.

title: Paper Republic: A collective of translators promoting Chinese literature
description: Paper Republic, a UK-registered charity founded in 2007, unites translators dedicated to bringing the best contemporary Chinese literature to English-language readers through free online publications and an extensive literary database.

title: NüVoices London Presents: China's underground sex industry and Lotus with Lijia Zhang
description: NüVoices London hosts author Lijia Zhang for a discussion of her debut novel Lotus, drawn from her grandmother's story, and the social forces driving China's vast underground sex industry.

title: Postcard Campaign: Free journalist and #MeToo activist Sophia Huang Xueqin
description: NüVoices DC rallies support for detained Chinese feminist journalist and #MeToo activist Sophia Huang Xueqin through a postcard campaign urging her release from Guangzhou's Baiyun Detention Center.

title: Board Member Karoline Kan Wins 2019 Young China Watcher of the Year
description: Board member Karoline Kan receives the 2019 Young China Watcher of the Year Award for her work deepening global understanding of China, including her memoir Under Red Skies.

title: NüVoices Podcast #20: Contemporary Chinese art and techno-orientalism with Xin Wang
description: Xin Wang, a fellow at the Whitney Museum and NYU Ph.D. student, joins hosts Chenni Xu and Cindy Gao to explore the landscape of contemporary Chinese art, Asian futurism, and techno-orientalism.

title: Introducing MADE IN: A new podcast promoting Asian-Canadian stories
description: MADE IN is a podcast by Evelyn Kwong exploring Asian-Canadian identity, from redefining beauty standards to dismantling the model minority myth, through candid conversations about the struggles and triumphs of Asian women in North America.

title: Packed room of 40+ joined London Wanel featuring Lijia Zhang on Lotus and China's sex trade
description: Author Lijia Zhang captivated a packed London audience with the story behind her novel Lotus, drawing on her grandmother's hidden past to illuminate the lives of sex workers in modern China.

title: NüVoices Podcast #21: Sino-Black relations with Keisha Brown
description: Historian Keisha Brown traces the deep, often overlooked history of Sino-Black relations, from W. E. B. Du Bois and Langston Hughes's ties to China to evolving perceptions of race and identity in the country today.

title: Director and screenwriter Wu Nan talks gender, storytelling and her first feature film "Push and Shove 狗眼看人心"
description: Wu Nan spent two decades as a screenwriter for directors like Zhang Yimou before making her own directorial debut — and she's determined to open doors for the next generation of Chinese women filmmakers.

title: Girl, Interpreted: a new bilingual comedy web series made in Melbourne
description: A Mandarin interpreter navigates chaotic cultural misunderstandings in this Melbourne-made bilingual comedy, drawn from creator Grace Feng Fang Juan's own professional experience.

title: NüVoices Podcast #23: Reimagining Hong Kong’s political communities
description: Writer and researcher Jessie Lau joins Joanna Chiu to discuss how Hong Kong's protests have deepened generational divides, reshaped diaspora identity, and forced families to confront what it means to be a Hongkonger.

title: In pictures: Behind the frontlines of the Hong Kong protests
description: Katherine Cheng's photo essay captures the raw intensity of Hong Kong's 2019 pro-democracy protests, offering intimate glimpses behind the frontlines of a movement that began over an extradition bill and grew into a sweeping demand for democratic freedoms.

title: NüVoices Podcast #24: Chinese philanthropy in the 21st century, with Emily Weaver
description: Emily Weaver, a philanthropy consultant with over a decade in China, discusses individual and digital giving, women's roles in shaping non-governmental work, and the impact of China's 2016 foreign NGO law.

title: I am a Wuhan girl
description: Journalist Yuli Yang writes from Hong Kong as her family endures Wuhan's lockdown, confronting anti-Chinese discrimination with an intimate portrait of her hometown and a plea for shared humanity.

title: NüVoices Podcast #25: A wealth of anger and a wealth of time – Wuhan and the coronavirus, with Rui Zhong
description: Rui Zhong of the Wilson Center joins co-host Cindy Gao to trace COVID-19's spread from her native Wuhan, examining the Chinese government's narrative control, the virus's disproportionate impact within China, and rising xenophobia toward Chinese communities worldwide.

title: London's Papergang Theatre presents FREEDOM HI 自由閪: A show exploring the Hong Kong protests
description: Papergang Theatre's FREEDOM HI 自由閪 brings together UK-based Hong Kong and British East Asian artists to examine the 2019 protests through new writing and performance art. The show runs March 10–15 at The Vaults in London.

title: Essay: Thrift Stor(i)es
description: Grace Ouyang examines the Chinese cultural taboo against secondhand clothing, navigating her love of thrifting against her family's disapproval from their Queens laundromat.

title: NüVoices Podcast #19: Leading by example: Female success in the workplace, with Rachel Morarjee
description: Former Financial Times correspondent and Economist Corporate Network director Rachel Morarjee discusses the 30% Club's push for women in leadership, navigating modern work environments, and why small daily commitments like meditation matter for self-care.

title: NüVoices Podcast #26: Di Wang on LGBTQ rights and representation in China
description: Researcher Di Wang examines the social and legal landscape for LGBTQ individuals in China, exploring community terminology, workplace inclusion, and the ripple effects of Taiwan's marriage equality milestone.

title: NüProfile: Madeline Leung Coleman on diaspora, feminism and freelance writing
description: Freelance writer Madeline Leung Coleman discusses diaspora, feminism, and the feature story about Chinatown punk venues that caught Awkwafina's eye for a film adaptation.

title: Why is China still so reluctant to help us find our birth parents?
description: André-Anne Côté, a Chinese adoptee raised in Quebec, examines why China continues to stonewall international adoptees seeking their birth families decades after the One-Child policy tore them apart.

title: Opinion: In Hong Kong, the government is weaponising sex to downplay its failures
description: Sophie Mak examines how Hong Kong's alcohol ban at eateries, justified by claims about drunken intimacy, reveals a pattern of the government weaponising sexual morality to deflect from its own policy shortcomings.

title: NüVoices Podcast #27: U.S.-China cyber competition and cooperation with Julia Voo
description: Harvard Kennedy School research director Julia Voo joins Cindy Gao to explore U.S.-China cyber competition, Digital Silk Road challenges, and how Track II diplomacy can help mitigate digital confrontation between the two powers.

title: NüVoices Podcast #28: Coronavirus and the racism epidemic, with Sophie Lu and Jessie Tu
description: NüVoices chair Joanna Chiu speaks with co-founder Sophie Lu and journalist Jessie Tu about the surge in anti-Asian racism during COVID-19, exploring how the diaspora and allies can confront hate crimes while navigating a global health crisis.

title: Film: Outcry and Whisper
description: Shot over eight years, this documentary weaves animation, interviews, and archives into a powerful manifesto chronicling Chinese and Hong Kong women's resistance against political violence, harassment, and systemic oppression.

title: NüVoices Podcast #30: Foreign correspondence and China, with Megha Rajagopalan
description: Award-winning BuzzFeed News correspondent Megha Rajagopalan and Chenni Xu explore the shifting landscape of foreign correspondence in China, from Beijing's golden age of reporting to rising censorship.

title: China's #MeToo: In literature and reality, the patriarchy keeps women from helping women. But they're fighting back.
description: Emily Matson examines how patriarchal structures in China—reflected in both literature and life—discourage women from supporting one another, and how the #MeToo movement is pushing back against censorship and silence.

title: Ferkat Jawdat is risking everything to speak out about China's crackdown on Uyghurs
description: Ferkat Jawdat's mother was detained in China's re-education camps. In this interview, the Uyghur American activist shares why he chose to speak out despite the risks to his family.

title: NüVoices Podcast #31: Seeking creativity through multimedia journalism with Yuan Ren
description: Journalist Yuan Ren traces her path from print to broadcast media, sharing tips for multimedia storytelling and discussing with Joanna Chiu what it takes to build a career in Western media as women of Chinese descent.

title: Chinese opera is being revitalized—with a gender twist
description: Elyse Ribbons treks to a remote mountain village in Ninghai to discover Boar-Tooth Opera—a centuries-old Chinese theatrical tradition finding new life through gender-defying performances.

title: Freelance: How to pitch Ariana magazine
description: This guide breaks down the pitching process for Ariana, a Hong Kong-based print and digital magazine covering social justice across Asia, from theme-specific story angles to the types of features its editors seek from freelance contributors.

title: China, the World, and the COVID Story: How We Got Here and What Lies Ahead
description: A digital summit co-organized by Chinese Storytellers, NüVoices, and Young China Watchers examines the coronavirus pandemic's geopolitical implications for China and the world through three webinars featuring journalists, experts, and diaspora writers.

title: Resources for China watchers to fight anti-Black racism
description: NüVoices compiles essential resources for China watchers seeking to confront anti-Black racism within Asian communities and build meaningful solidarity with BIPOC movements.

title: How women artists are navigating China's complex feminist landscape
description: Luise Guest explores how feminism remains contested terrain in China, tracing its complex history from revolutionary martyr Qiu Jin to contemporary women artists who challenge and redefine gender discourse on their own terms.

title: NüVoices Podcast #32: Creative entrepreneurship with Qian Zhang
description: Entrepreneur Qian Zhang traces her path from Alibaba's Global Leadership Academy to Harvard Business School and the founding of The Puer Movement, a pu'er tea brand on a mission to bridge cultural divides one cup at a time.

title: Our summit on China and the COVID Story with Chinese Storytellers and Young China Watchers was a sold-out success
description: NüVoices, Chinese Storytellers, and Young China Watchers hosted a sold-out digital summit exploring COVID-19's geopolitical impact through three panels featuring journalists, experts, and diaspora writers from around the world.

title: UK to review Hong Kong British National Overseas status, but domestic violence victims are left out of the discussion
description: The UK's planned expansion of British National Overseas status rights for Hongkongers promises historic visa changes, but critics warn the review overlooks a vulnerable group: domestic violence victims who have already entered the country.

title: NüVoices Podcast #34: April Zhu on reporting from Nairobi, part 1
description: In this two-part episode, freelance journalist April Zhu speaks with NüVoices board member Cindy Gao about reporting from Nairobi, covering gender, urban inequality, and the nuances often missing from China-Africa discourse.

title: Hu Jie: The Chinese documentary filmmaker exposing the harsh realities of early Communist Party rule
description: Chinese documentary filmmaker Hu Jie risks government pressure to expose the brutal truths of Maoist China, from the Great Famine to the Cultural Revolution, in his acclaimed trilogy of films.

title: NüVoices Podcast #35: The nation of diaspora: April Zhu on reporting from Nairobi, part 2
description: In part two of this conversation, freelance journalist April Zhu discusses reporting from Nairobi on gender, urban inequality, and China–Kenya relations, exploring why nuance—not Sinophilia—is the antidote to Sinophobia.

title: NüVoices Podcast #36: Mobility for Africa, with Shantha Bloemen
description: Shantha Bloemen discusses bringing electric mobility to rural Africa, China's shifting development model, and why gender-focused social enterprise is key to transforming South-South partnerships.

title: NüVoices and YCW London presents: Gender and climate change in China
description: NüVoices and Young China Watchers London host a digital panel exploring the intersection of gender and climate change in China, featuring journalist Karoline Kan and activist Zongqi Yu on women's roles in environmental activism and gendered climate discourse.

title: NüProfile: Grace Ly speaks about Chinese identities in France, anti-Asian racism, and exploring culture through food
description: Grace Ly discusses navigating Chinese-Cambodian identity in France, confronting anti-Asian racism, and how food became a gateway to reclaiming her cultural heritage through writing, film, and podcasting.

title: NüVoices Podcast #37: Chinese cuisine in America, with Simone Tong
description: Chef Simone Tong of Little Tong Noodle Shop and Silver Apricot discusses navigating New York's restaurant scene during the pandemic, the evolving identity of Chinese cuisine in America, and the personal inspirations behind her cooking.

title: Please support NüVoices, registered non-profit
description: NüVoices, an international editorial collective celebrating women and BIPOC voices on China, announces its official U.S. non-profit status, making donations tax-deductible and inviting community support for its magazine, podcast, and experts directory.

title: IN PHOTOS: Capturing culture in Tibet as a French Canadian, Han Chinese tourist
description: A French-Canadian Chinese adoptee blends into a Han Chinese tour group in Qinghai, capturing through photography the uneasy cultural tensions between Chinese tourism and Tibetan life.

title: WATCH: Gender and climate change in China
description: Karoline Kan and Zongqi Yu explore how women and young activists in China tackle climate change through education and government collaboration, navigating a landscape where Western-style protest is forbidden.

title: NüVoices Podcast #38: Fulbright’s exit from China and Hong Kong
description: Sophie Lu, a Fulbright alumna, convenes a panel of scholarship recipients to examine the cancellation of the Fulbright program in China and Hong Kong and its implications for U.S.-China educational and cultural exchange.

title: NüProfile: Jinghua Qian on why "China-watching" is problematic, inclusion and un-belonging in Australia
description: Shanghai-born, Melbourne-based writer Jinghua Qian unpacks the politics of "China-watching," diaspora representation, and what it means to experience un-belonging in Australia.

title: Review: Mulan reinforces Han ethnonationalism and the patriarchy
description: Emily Matson argues that Disney's live-action Mulan erases the legend's non-Han origins, reinforcing ethnonationalist narratives and historical inaccuracies that align with CCP ideology.

title: NüVoices Podcast #40: What’s next for Hollywood and China after ‘Mulan’ flop, with Becky Davis
description: NüVoices chair Joanna Chiu speaks with Variety China bureau chief Rebecca Davis about the disappointing box-office performance of Disney's Mulan remake and what it reveals about the future of Hollywood-China cultural exchange amid rising geopolitical tensions.

title: Review: My Prince Edward, a modern Hong Kong love story by writer-director Norris Wong
description: Daisy Singh-Greaves reviews My Prince Edward, Norris Wong's intimate Hong Kong drama about a woman navigating a sham marriage, societal pressure, and the quiet fight for independence.

title: NüVoices Podcast #41: Development finance and Chinese identity, with Yunnan Chen
description: Senior research officer Yunnan Chen explores China-Africa development finance, her fieldwork across the continent, and reflections on Chinese identity within the UK's Asian diaspora.

title: NüVoices Podcast #42: Hong Kong media, redefined
description: Jennifer Creery of Hong Kong Free Press guest-hosts a conversation with journalists Mary Hui and Phoebe Kong on how Hong Kong's national security law is reshaping the media landscape and press freedoms in the territory.

title: WATCH: China's Black community speaks out on identity, racism and solidarity
description: A multimedia project amplifies the voices of Black residents in China as they share firsthand experiences of identity, discrimination, and solidarity amid the country's emerging mainstream debate on race.

title: NüVoices Podcast #43: Literary translation and language as resistance, with Anne Henochowicz
description: Anne Henochowicz, translator and China Digital Times translations coordinator, discusses literary translation as a form of resistance, the translator's responsibility to original texts, and how COVID-19 has reshaped online discourse in China.

title: Losing a Grandmother, Learning Her Language
description: Tara Sun Vanacore traces how learning Mandarin unlocked a deeper bond with her grandmother, the celebrated Chinese-American novelist Yu Lihua, revealing the woman behind the literary legend.

title: NüVoices Podcast #39: Beijing Lights: A conversation with Huang Chenkuang
description: Anthony Tao speaks with journalist Huang Chenkuang about her Beijing Lights interview series, which profiles ordinary people on the margins of society—housekeepers, blind masseuses, fortune-tellers—capturing their stories, regrets, and dreams.

title: EXPLAINER: China's Domestic Violence Epidemic amid COVID-19
description: COVID-19 lockdowns triggered a surge in domestic violence across China. This explainer traces the history of anti-DV efforts and the systemic barriers that continue to silence victims.

title: NüVoices Podcast #45: An uncertain future with guaranteed friction: U.S.-China economic coercion, with Ashley Feng
description: Researcher Ashley Feng joins NüVoices chair Joanna Chiu to examine how U.S.-China economic coercion—from tariffs to investment restrictions—impacts the lives of students, scientists, and immigrants.

title: 'Send me to the clouds' is a scathing indictment of the stigma surrounding leftover women
description: Teng Congcong's debut feature confronts China's "leftover women" stigma with sharp wit and compassion, following a journalist facing cancer who refuses to let society define her worth.

title: NüVoices Podcast #46: Retail and e-commerce boom and bust in mainland and Hong Kong during COVID-19, with Tiffany Ap
description: China bureau chief Tiffany Ap joins the NüVoices Podcast to explore the post-lockdown revival of fashion and retail, the explosive rise of e-commerce livestreaming, Hong Kong's retail downturn, and a viral sexual harassment hashtag.

title: An unexpected outlet: The Chinese theatre troupe creating safe spaces for marginalized voices
description: A young Guangzhou theatre collective uses improvised performance to create rare safe spaces in China, inviting audiences to share stories of HIV, domestic violence, and queer identity.

title: Anthropologist: Taiwanese identity is a 'paradox' of conflicting beliefs – but social bonds create unity
description: An anthropologist's fieldwork during Taiwan's 2020 election reveals that ordinary citizens hold surprisingly contradictory views on national identity, yet everyday social bonds bridge deep political and cultural divides.

title: NüVoices Podcast #47: Women in fintech, with Rita Liu
description: Fintech veteran Rita Liu traces her journey from American Express to scaling Alipay's international business, joining Chenni Xu to discuss Chinese fintech's origins, its global future, and gender representation in finance.

title: NüVoices Podcast #48: U.S.-Taiwan relations: From Trump to Biden
description: Experts Margaret Lewis and Jessica Drun join host Joanna Chiu from Taipei to unpack the implications of the U.S. lifting restrictions on Taiwan exchanges—and whether the last-minute policy shift helps or harms the island.

title: Virtual events for Te-Ping Chen's story collection, Land of Big Numbers
description: NüVoices celebrates community member Te-Ping Chen's debut collection "Land of Big Numbers," a critically acclaimed set of stories exploring modern China, with details on virtual book launch events in February 2021.

title: Opinion: As a female artist, I kept shortchanging myself. Now, I try to know my value
description: Artist Jane Peng recounts how she repeatedly underpriced her own paintings—only to discover buyers would have paid double or triple—and explores why so many women systematically undervalue their creative work.

title: NüVoices Podcast #49: Walking through development mandalas in the eastern Tibetan Plateau, with Pamela Logan
description: Dr. Pamela Logan discusses her book Compassion Mandala and the philosophy behind her 14-year mission with Kham Aid Foundation in eastern Tibet, from education and healthcare to the resilience of Tibetan women.

title: NüVoices Podcast #50: Directing "Finding Yingying", with Jenny Shi
description: Filmmaker Jenny Shi reflects on her award-winning documentary Finding Yingying, exploring the creative process, emotional toll, and mental health challenges of documentary work.

title: Review: Te-Ping Chen's "Land of Big Numbers" sketches the diversity of modern China
description: Te-Ping Chen's debut story collection moves beyond familiar large-scale narratives of China, drawing on her journalism experience to illuminate the rich interior lives of individuals navigating modern Chinese society.

title: Translation: Poems by Chinese feminist and revolutionary writer Qiu Jin
description: Translator Yilin Wang once brought the fierce poetry of Qiu Jin, a pioneering Chinese feminist and revolutionary, to English-language readers. This content has since been removed at the translator's request.

title: Resources to fight anti-East, Southeast Asian & Pacific Islander racism
description: A curated collection of resources for combating anti-East Asian, Southeast Asian, and Pacific Islander racism, featuring grassroots organizations, bystander intervention guides, and community toolkits for solidarity and support.

title: In China, pole dancing evolved from a male art practice in the Song Dynasty to an inclusive sport promoting body positivity
description: From a male-only acrobatic art rooted in the Song Dynasty to a booming fitness movement, pole dancing in China has evolved into an inclusive sport championing body positivity across cities nationwide.

title: NüVoices Podcast #52: Talking fiction writing and modern China, with Te-Ping Chen
description: Te-Ping Chen, Wall Street Journal correspondent and NüVoices founding member, discusses her debut story collection "Land of Big Numbers," exploring how journalism shaped her fiction about everyday lives in modern China.

title: Amy Sommers on her debut historical novel, Rumors from Shanghai
description: Amy Sommers draws on the forgotten history of Black Americans in Seattle and 1940s Shanghai to craft a debut thriller about race, opportunity, and looming danger on the eve of Pearl Harbor.

title: NüVoices Podcast #54: Telling Asian and Asian-American stories through video journalism, with Dolly Li
description: Award-winning video journalist and filmmaker Dolly Li joins Cindy Gao to explore the power of visual storytelling in documenting multi-generational immigrant and Asian-American narratives, and navigating identity across borders.

title: Young China Watchers event: A Discussion of LGBTQ+ Progress and Activism in China
description: Young China Watchers convened experts Ivy Wong, Jessie Lau, and AJ Song to examine LGBTQ+ progress and activism in mainland China and Hong Kong, exploring recent victories, persistent barriers, and the push for workplace inclusion.

title: NüVoices Podcast #55: Unraveling Australia-China relations, with Natasha Kassam
description: Lowy Institute director Natasha Kassam joins NüVoices chair Joanna Chiu to trace how Australia-China relations reached a historic low—and why the fallout has hit Chinese-Australians hardest.

title: Introducing: The 异乡人 (Yi Xiang Ren) podcast featuring immigrant stories
description: A new Mandarin-language podcast spotlights the untold journeys of Chinese immigrants worldwide, weaving personal narratives of identity, culture, and belonging from a diaspora of over 50 million.

title: Censoring feminist discussions will not solve China’s population crisis
description: China's crackdown on feminist groups like 6B4T on social media has only amplified radical feminism's visibility, argues Lijia Zhang, who says addressing systemic discrimination—not censorship—is key to reversing the country's population decline.

title: NüVoices Podcast #56: Censorship and resistance, with Sophie Beach
description: Sophie Beach, executive editor of China Digital Times, discusses the platform's origins, China's ever-evolving censorship tactics, and the imperative of amplifying Chinese netizens' voices of resistance.

title: NüVoices Podcast #57: Revolutionary feminism, wuxia, and the politics of translation, with Yilin Wang
description: Yilin Wang joins NüVoices chair Joanna Chiu to discuss translating revolutionary feminist Qiū Jǐn's poetry, the #LiteraryJianghu Project promoting wuxia literature, and the power politics of working as a translator and writer in North America.

title: Exhibition and Live Discussion with Iris Yau: ‘Opium, Silk and the Missionaries in China’
description: Curator Iris Yau's auto-ethnography-inspired exhibition at SOAS's Brunei Gallery traces forgotten 19th-century ties between Britain and China through 97 artefacts on loan from archives and private collections worldwide, accompanied by a live gallery discussion.

title: An Ode to Sound: NüVoices podcast co-host Cindy Gao on audio storytelling
description: NüVoices podcast co-host Cindy Gao reflects on the craft of audio storytelling, sharing her interview process and the relentless commitment behind building a show that amplifies women and non-binary creatives connected to China.

title: NüVoices Podcast #58: The shrinking China foreign press corps, and reporting in Xinjiang, with Sophia Yan
description: Telegraph correspondent Sophia Yan joins Joanna Chiu to discuss the dwindling foreign press corps in China and her harrowing firsthand reporting from Xinjiang on the new phase of Uyghur persecution.

title: Introducing ‘Hong Kong Silenced’: a new Telegraph podcast documenting Beijing's crackdown
description: NüVoices board member and Telegraph correspondent Sophia Yan anchors this four-part podcast series documenting how Beijing's National Security Law has reshaped daily life in Hong Kong.

title: NüVoices Podcast #59: COVID-19 origins and the state of science reporting in China, with Kathleen McLaughlin
description: Science reporter Kathleen McLaughlin and NüVoices member Rui Zhong discuss COVID-19 origin theories and the state of science journalism in China, drawing on the country's history of handling HIV/AIDS and the CRISPR controversy.

title: NüVoices Podcast #60: Getting tea drunk, with Shunan Teng
description: Tea Drunk founder Shunan Teng shares her deep expertise on China's heritage teas, exploring the regions, production techniques, and tasting methods that reveal their full complexity.

title: CONTRIBUTE TO CHINA BRIEF: Our five tips for policy writing
description: Elizabeth Chen, editor of the Jamestown Foundation's China Brief, shares five essential principles for crafting compelling policy analysis—from maintaining narrative focus to grounding arguments in fact-based research.

title: NüVoices Podcast #61: Decoding Chinese technology policy, with Lotus Ruan
description: Lotus Ruan of the Citizen Lab joins Rui Zhong to discuss her research on Chinese app privacy, Apple's strategy in China, and the complexities of navigating China's technology policy landscape.

title: Queer East Film Festival aims to amplify Asian communities in the UK
description: Queer East Film Festival showcases 37 films from 15 countries, amplifying queer Asian voices often excluded from mainstream UK discourse through storytelling, activism, and cross-cultural dialogue.

title: Book Excerpt: 'More Than One Child' by Shen Yang
description: Shen Yang's debut memoir recounts her life as an "excess child" under China's One-Child Policy, forced to hide from authorities and live in the shadows of a society that denied her existence.

title: APPLY: Queer China UK's Transnational Chinese Queer Leadership Programme
description: Queer China UK opens applications for its winter Transnational Chinese Queer Leadership Programme, a four-month mentorship pairing participants with international professors, activists, and LGBTQ+ leaders to build cross-border solidarity and advocacy skills.

title: NüVoices Podcast #62: Eat the Buddha: A conversation with award-winning author Barbara Demick
description: Award-winning author Barbara Demick discusses Eat the Buddha, her deeply reported account of a remote Tibetan town, illuminating decades of intertwined Tibetan and Chinese history and what it means to be Tibetan today.

title: As China's landmark #MeToo case is dismissed in court, it's clear the legal system must do more for survivors
description: Lijia Zhang examines why China's legal system fails survivors of sexual misconduct, as the dismissal of Zhou Xiaoxuan's landmark #MeToo case exposes the near-impossible evidentiary burden placed on those who speak out.

title: NüVoices Podcast #63: China-New Zealand Relations with NZ Ambassador Clare Fearnley
description: New Zealand's ambassador to China Clare Fearnley, a Mandarin speaker with decades of diplomatic experience across Asia, joins Sophia Yan to discuss NZ-China relations and gender equality.

title: NüVoices chair Joanna Chiu on the launch of CHINA UNBOUND
description: NüVoices chair Joanna Chiu celebrates the launch of China Unbound, her decade-in-the-making investigation into Beijing's global reach across four continents. The book has been named a best book of Fall 2021 by multiple outlets.

title: Review: Han Chinese filmmaker Wang Lina's "A First Farewell" is an uneasy depiction of Uyghur childhood
description: Annabelle Jarrett reviews Han Chinese filmmaker Wang Lina's debut, which follows two Uyghur children in Xinjiang—a rare on-screen portrayal of minority life amid China's sweeping security crackdown.

title: NüVoices Podcast #64: China Unbound: A Conversation with Joanna Chiu and Madeleine O'Dea
description: Joanna Chiu discusses her book *China Unbound* with guest host Madeleine O'Dea, exploring how Western nations have failed to reckon with China's ambitions to reshape—not join—the existing global order.

title: NüVoices Podcast #65: Xinjiang, HK, and Sanctions with Sophie Richardson, China Director of Human Rights Watch
description: Sophie Richardson, China Director of Human Rights Watch, joins journalist Sophia Yan to discuss human rights in Xinjiang and Hong Kong, the experience of being sanctioned by Beijing, and how HRW supports staff wellbeing amid demanding work.

title: Book Excerpt: 'Feminisms with Chinese Characteristics'
description: Scholars Ping Zhu and Hui Xiao trace the diverse feminist movements that have reshaped China since the 1995 Beijing women's conference, challenging the notion of a singular state feminism with an interdisciplinary exploration of activism, culture, and gender politics.

title: NüVoices Podcast #66: Translating Jin Yong's Legends of the Condor Heroes with Gigi Chang and Shelly Bryant, Part 1
description: Translators Gigi Chang and Shelly Bryant discuss the challenges of rendering Jin Yong's beloved wuxia epic Legends of the Condor Heroes into English, from elaborate fight scenes to cultural nuance.

title: LONDON PANEL: "China Unbound" book launch with author Joanna Chiu, in conversation with Megha Rajagopalan
description: NüVoices chair Joanna Chiu discusses her bestselling debut "China Unbound" with Pulitzer-winning journalist Megha Rajagopalan, exploring Beijing's global power expansion and its human consequences in a wide-ranging conversation at SOAS University of London.

title: NüVoices Podcast #67: Translating Jin Yong's Legends of the Condor Heroes with Gigi Chang and Shelly Bryant, Part 2
description: Translators Gigi Chang and Shelly Bryant delve into the cultural complexities of bringing Jin Yong's iconic wuxia saga to English readers, from navigating the male gaze to depicting non-Han Chinese characters.

title: RECAP: London "China Unbound" launch with Joanna Chiu in conversation with Megha Rajagopalan
description: NüVoices London hosted author Joanna Chiu in conversation with Pulitzer winner Megha Rajagopalan to discuss Chiu's book "China Unbound," exploring Beijing's global ambitions and the human consequences of China's rise as a world power.

title: NüVoices Podcast #68: More Than One Child: A Conversation with memoirist Shen Yang
description: Memoirist Shen Yang discusses her turbulent childhood as an "excess child" during China's one-child policy and the hidden toll of family planning on a generation raised in secrecy.

title: NüVoices Podcast #69: Chinese AI, Cybersecurity, and Internet Policy with Shazeda Ahmed
description: PhD candidate Shazeda Ahmed joins guest host Rui Zhong to discuss AI in Chinese courtrooms, algorithmic discrimination, and whether the U.S. and China are locked in a tech cold war, in this 2021 season finale of the NüVoices Podcast.

title: NüVoices Podcast #70: Subcultures, trends, and being a non-visible "foreign" correspondent in East Asia with Crystal Tai
description: Crystal Tai discusses her work as a non-visible foreign correspondent in East Asia, from infiltrating K-pop training academies to covering Hong Kong's protests, and her book exploring South Korea's solo-lifestyle movement.

title: Behind the Scenes: how April Zhu recorded our new podcast theme song
description: Journalist and multi-instrumentalist April Zhu reveals how she crafted the NüVoices podcast's funky new theme song, blending blues-scale bass, clawhammer ukulele, and inventive sonic effects.

title: NüVoices Podcast #71: The Impossible City, a Conversation with Karen Cheung
description: Hong Kong writer Karen Cheung joins host Jessie Lau to discuss her memoir The Impossible City, blending reportage and personal narrative to explore the city's protest movements, housing struggles, and the search for belonging.

title: Letter by Chinese feminists: Free Detained Journalist Sophia Huang Xueqin and Activist Wang Jianbing
description: Chinese feminists call for the release of journalist Sophia Huang Xueqin and labor activist Wang Jianbing, detained since 2021 on subversion charges, while questioning the silence of institutions like the University of Sussex and the Chevening Awards Programme.

title: NüVoices Podcast #72: Messy Roots, a Conversation with Laura Gao
description: Graphic memoirist Laura Gao discusses "Messy Roots," her viral-comic-turned-book tracing her journey from Wuhan to Texas, touching on identity, internalized racism, and coming out as queer.

title: NüVoices Podcast #73: China's stance on the Russian war in Ukraine with Elizabeth Wishnick
description: Dr. Elizabeth Wishnick joins host Sophia Yan to unpack China's "checkered response" to Russia's war in Ukraine, exploring why Beijing refuses to call it an invasion and where the Sino-Russian partnership is headed.

title: LIVE Podcast Recording: Katie Stallard, author of "Dancing on Bones"
description: Host Joanna Chiu interviews veteran foreign correspondent Katie Stallard about Dancing on Bones, her deeply reported study of how China, Russia, and North Korea weaponize history to consolidate power.

title: NüVoices Podcast #74: Business, billionaires, and global supply chain woes with journalist Hope King
description: Axios business reporter Hope King discusses China's lockdowns disrupting global supply chains, the rise of female self-made billionaires, and companies exiting Russia, while reflecting on her pivot from Wall Street to journalism as a Chinese American.

title: NüVoices Podcast #75: Dancing on Bones book launch, a conversation with Katie Stallard
description: Katie Stallard joins NüVoices to discuss her book *Dancing on Bones*, exploring how China, Russia, and North Korea wield WWII narratives to shape national identity, with insights on Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: NüVoices Podcast #76: A Conversation with Elaine Hsieh Chou on her debut novel, Disorientation
description: Elaine Hsieh Chou discusses her satirical debut novel "Disorientation," unpacking orientalism in academia, campus free speech wars, and the fraught question of who has the right to tell whose stories.

title: NüVoices is hiring a podcast producer!
description: NüVoices seeks an entry-level podcast producer to edit audio and assemble bi-weekly episodes highlighting women and non-binary creatives connected to China, at $120 USD per episode.

title: Poet Lerato Mathibe explores feminism, blackness and spirituality in 'Baby Steps'
description: South African poet and educator Lerato Mathibe reflects on feminism, blackness, and spirituality from Nanjing, China, where her debut chapbook "Baby Steps" charts a journey of self-discovery and empowerment.

title: NüVoices Podcast #77: Voice Actress Nancy Wu on Diversity in Audiobooks
description: Narrator Nancy Wu, whose credits span the Avatar prequels to works by Amy Tan and Cixin Liu, makes the case for why BIPOC voice actors deserve stories beyond their ethnicities.

title: NüVoices Podcast #78: Outsourcing Repression, a Conversation with Lynette Ong
description: Political scientist Lynette Ong unpacks how China outsources everyday repression to nonstate actors—hired enforcers behind land grabs, housing demolitions, and journalist surveillance.

title: Book Excerpt: 'China’s Millennial Digital Generation' by Karen Ma
description: Karen Ma's book examines how China's post-1980s rural indie filmmakers harnessed digital technology to find their voices, win international prizes, and bring previously marginalized stories to light.

title: Podcast Crossover: Time To Say Goodbye on  'Ascension', a documentary about Chinese consumerism and labor force
description: In this crossover from Time To Say Goodbye, Andy Liu speaks with the creators of "Ascension," an Oscar-shortlisted documentary exploring labor, consumerism, and class mobility in contemporary China.

title: Podcast Crossover: Self-Evident, 'A Day at the Mall'
description: During a summer hiatus, NüVoices shares an episode from Self-Evident in which producer Erica Mu returns to her hometown mall, capturing the dreams and everyday lives of its diverse Asian American community.

title: NüVoices Podcast #79: Taiwan and US Foreign Policy with Meia and Veerle Nouwens
description: Twin sisters and defense analysts Meia Nouwen and Veerle Nouwens join the podcast to dissect Nancy Pelosi's landmark Taiwan visit, China's military response, and the implications of US strategic ambiguity for cross-strait relations.

title: Podcast Crossover: Rough Translation and China's Anti-Work Vibes (plus an exciting NüVoices podcast update)
description: In a crossover with NPR's Rough Translation, reporter Emily Feng unpacks China's anti-work movements from 躺平 to 丧文化, plus NüVoices introduces its new podcast production team.

title: NüVoices Podcast #80: A Conversation with Emily Feng, NPR's Beijing Correspondent
description: NPR Beijing correspondent Emily Feng traces her path from freelancer to foreign correspondent, discussing frontline reporting from Ukraine, groundbreaking Xinjiang investigations, and a viral story about snail noodles.

title: NüVoices Podcast #81: Food journalism & Taiwanese cuisine with Clarissa Wei
description: Veteran food journalist Clarissa Wei discusses her path from backpacking in China to covering Taiwanese cuisine, cross-strait relations, and sustainability, plus her forthcoming book "Made in Taiwan," in this episode hosted by Solarina Ho.

title: Why it’s misleading to call Xi Jinping the “new Mao”
description: Emily Matson argues that while Xi Jinping has consolidated more power than any leader since Mao, drawing direct parallels between the two oversimplifies their vastly different visions for China.

title: NüVoices Podcast #82: Chinese Canadian Immigrant Histories with Arlene Chan and Melanie Ng
description: Historians Arlene Chan and Melanie Ng trace the arc of Chinese Canadian migration, from 19th-century arrivals through exclusionary immigration laws to present-day sinophobia, while spotlighting the legacy of activist Jean Lumb in dismantling Canada's racist policies.

title: Book review: Li Zhang’s “Anxious China” humanizes the country's mental health crisis
description: Miranda Jarrett reviews Li Zhang's anthropological study of China's mental health boom, where rising anxiety and "empty-heart disease" are driving millions toward therapy and self-reflection.

title: NüVoices Podcast #83: A Map for the Missing, a Conversation with Belinda Huijuan Tang
description: Novelist Belinda Huijuan Tang discusses her acclaimed debut A Map for the Missing, family memory, and centering personal agency over political narrative in Chinese storytelling.

title: NüVoices Podcast #84: A Conversation with Sue-Lin Wong on 'The Prince' podcast & China's 20th Party Congress
description: Sue-Lin Wong discusses her eight-part podcast 'The Prince,' tracing Xi Jinping's path from Cultural Revolution trauma to his third term, while also recapping key moments from China's 20th Party Congress.

title: NüVoices Podcast #85: Becoming a Stand-up Comedian with He Huang
description: Sydney-based comedian He Huang discusses her viral Australia's Got Talent audition, her pivot from public policy to stand-up, and how she navigates racial stereotypes and sexism in comedy.

title: NüVoices Podcast #86: Angela Hui about her memoir, Takeaway: Stories from a Childhood Behind the Counter
description: Angela Hui joins host Lijia Zhang to discuss her memoir *Takeaway*, a candid account of growing up in her family's Chinese takeaway in rural Wales—navigating racism, identity, and the bittersweet rhythms of life behind the counter.

title: Voices: Chinese protesters in Shanghai and London reflect on anti-lockdown demonstrations
description: Two participants in China's landmark "White Paper" protests — the largest demonstrations since Tiananmen Square — reflect on the movement's aftermath and the ongoing struggle for freedom.

title: NüVoices Podcast #87: Our 2022 Year-End Recap! A Discussion with the NüVoices Podcast Team
description: The NüVoices podcast team reunites for a season-ending roundtable, reflecting on 2022's standout episodes and China's seismic year—from zero-COVID protests to Xi Jinping's consolidation of power.

title: Here Are 12 Feminist Books to Read from 20th Century China
description: Emily Matson surveys 12 essential works by the forerunners of Chinese feminism, tracing a century of resistance from anti-Qing revolutionary Qiu Jin to celebrated novelist Eileen Chang.

title: NüVoices Podcast #88: The End of China's Zero-Covid Policy with Dr. Jennifer Bouey
description: Dr. Jennifer Bouey joins host Solarina Ho to unpack China's abrupt abandonment of zero-Covid, examining low vaccination rates, mRNA vaccine politics, and the true toll of the resulting outbreak.

title: NüVoices Podcast #89: A Conversation with Liza Lin on Digital Surveillance in China
description: WSJ reporter Liza Lin discusses her book *Surveillance State*, tracing China's digital surveillance from its deployment in Xinjiang to nationwide reach and its chilling effect on journalism and dissent.

title: NüVoices Podcast #90: A Conversation with Lindsay Wong, author of Tell Me Pleasant Things About Immortality & The Woo-Woo
description: Lindsay Wong discusses her grotesque and witty short story collection *Tell Me Pleasant Things About Immortality*, exploring immigrant horror, gatekeeping in publishing, and writing Chinese characters beyond the model minority myth.

title: NüVoices Podcast #91: Tania Branigan on her book, Red Memory, and the lasting impact of China's Cultural Revolution
description: Guardian journalist Tania Branigan discusses Red Memory with host Lijia Zhang, examining how China's Cultural Revolution shaped intergenerational trauma and collective memory.

title: NüVoices Podcast #92: The World of Chinese Sci-Fi, Fantasy, and Translation with Emily Xueni Jin
description: Translator Emily Xueni Jin discusses the collaborative art of bringing Chinese science fiction to English readers, and why translation is less about converting words than mediating between cultures.

title: RECAP: Community Reading in NYC with Accent Society
description: NüVoices and Accent Society brought five female writers together at NYC's Yu and Me Books for "Winter Recipes," an evening of readings spanning reverse-migration, translation politics, and Eileen Chang's time at Yaddo.

title: NüVoices Podcast #93: What the West Gets Wrong about TikTok with Zeyi Yang
description: MIT Technology Review reporter Zeyi Yang joins co-hosts Megan Cattel and Solarina Ho to unpack Western misconceptions about TikTok, examining which concerns about ByteDance hold up to scrutiny and which are political oversimplifications.

title: NüVoices Podcast #94: A Conversation with Yaxue Cao, founder of ChinaChange.org
description: Yaxue Cao, founder and editor of ChinaChange.org, discusses her advocacy for Chinese human rights defenders and her journey into civil society work in this conversation with host Siodhbhra Parkin.

title: NüVoices Book Picks for Asian Heritage Month
description: NüVoices partners with indie publisher House of Anansi to spotlight essential reads by authors of Asian heritage, with 10% of online sales supporting the platform's mission to amplify underrepresented voices in publishing.

title: NüVoices Podcast #95: Jan Wong on her Legendary Journalism Career
description: Canadian journalist Jan Wong traces her extraordinary career from studying at Peking University during the Cultural Revolution to witnessing the Tiananmen Massacre as a foreign correspondent.

title: Event Recap: Not even an incoming blizzard stopped the launch of NüVoices Canada
description: NüVoices Canada launched in Toronto with a spirited dinner discussion on China-Canada relations, defying a dramatic thundersnow blizzard over Lake Ontario to spark dialogue on media diversity and foreign interference.

title: NüProfile: Ysabelle Cheung on poetry, diaspora and writing from the margins
description: Megan Cattel interviews British-Chinese writer Ysabelle Cheung on poetry, diaspora identity, and navigating Hong Kong's expat world as a voice from the margins.

title: NüVoices Podcast #96: A Conversation with Crystal Tai about Chinese digital nomads
description: Crystal Tai, Jing Daily's senior editor, joins host Megan Cattel to explore why Chinese millennials are abandoning the grueling 996 work culture to become digital nomads, tracing the trend's roots in pandemic burnout and rising living costs.

title: Writer-director Shen Yu’s debut “Old Town Girls” captures the hopes and despairs of China's youth
description: Shen Yu's striking debut blends neo-noir crime thriller with coming-of-age drama, exposing how China's rapid economic growth has left its youngest generation vulnerable and adrift.

title: NüVoices Podcast #97: Highlighting human-centric China stories with Ye Charlotte Ming and Beimeng Fu
description: NüVoices co-host Megan Cattel speaks with Ye Charlotte Ming and Beimeng Fu, founders of the Far & Near Substack, about their visual journalism newsletter depicting China's complexity and the human stories behind its biggest headlines.

title: NüVoices Podcast #98: A Conversation with Monica Liu on her book, "E-mail Order Brides Under China's Global Rise"
description: Sociologist Monica Liu discusses her book on China's email-order bride industry, revealing how middle-aged divorced women seeking Western husbands challenge stereotypes about cross-border marriage and reshape notions of race, class, and masculinity.

title: How China's leaders changed the history of the War of Resistance to bolster Party prestige
description: Emily Matson examines China's 2017 decision to officially redate the War of Resistance against Japan from 1937 to 1931, revealing how the Party reshapes wartime narrative to bolster its legitimacy.

title: NüVoices Podcast #99: Introducing our Taiwan Mini-Series, Yu-Jie Chen on China-Taiwan relations
description: Yu-Jie Chen joins host Sophia Yan to unpack three centuries of Taiwanese history, shifting political identities, and the complexities of cross-strait relations as NüVoices launches a Taiwan mini-series ahead of the island's elections.

title: Our 100th Podcast Episode Special! Remembering Coco Lee, Janet Yellen's Visit to China, and More
description: NüVoices marks its 100th podcast episode with a wide-ranging panel discussion spanning Coco Lee's legacy, Janet Yellen's Beijing visit amid U.S.-China tensions, and cross-cultural storytelling.

title: A Chinese drama is sparking debates about sexual harassment and victim-blaming culture
description: Lijia Zhang examines how Chinese drama Imperfect Victim ignited fierce public debate over workplace sexual harassment, victim-blaming, and the power dynamics that silence women.

title: NüVoices Podcast #101: Adapting YA bestseller 'Loveboat, Taipei' to the big screen with Abigail Hing Wen
description: Author Abigail Hing Wen discusses her NYT bestselling YA novel Loveboat, Taipei, its film adaptation Love in Taipei, and the storied history of Taiwan's government-subsidized summer program that forged lasting bonds among diaspora youth for decades.

title: LONDON EVENT: Ian Johnson in Conversation with Zhang Lijia on 'Sparks'
description: Pulitzer Prize-winning author Ian Johnson joins NüVoices board member Zhang Lijia to discuss his latest book, Sparks, a vital account of China's underground historians challenging the Communist Party's monopoly on history.

title: NüVoices Podcast #102: A Conversation with Yun-Ching Ko about the Taiwan Innocence Project
description: Yun-Ching Ko, campaign director of the Taiwan Innocence Project, joins host Sophia Yan to discuss TIP's mission to exonerate the wrongfully convicted and reform Taiwan's criminal justice system.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #103: Julia Lovell on China's Hidden Century, an exhibit at The British Museum
description: Scholar Julia Lovell joins host Lijia Zhang to discuss curating The British Museum's groundbreaking "Hidden Century" exhibition, which reframes the Qing dynasty as an era of creative expression rather than solely one of turmoil.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #104: Clarissa Wei and Ivy Chen on their new cookbook, Made in Taiwan
description: Journalist Clarissa Wei and chef Ivy Chen discuss their cookbook "Made in Taiwan," exploring how food shapes Taiwanese identity, Indigenous and Hakka culinary influences, and the culture behind the recipes.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #105: Bethany Allen-Ebrahimian on her new book, Beijing Rules
description: Bethany Allen-Ebrahimian joins host Joanna Chiu to discuss her book Beijing Rules, exploring how China leverages economic power to shape global behavior and why democracies can still push back with the right policies.

title: Tears of Salt: Review of 'Salt Town' by Yi Xiaohe
description: Irene Zhang reviews Yi Xiaohe's Salt Town, a searing dispatch from rural China where decades of economic progress have done little to ease the entrenched disadvantages faced by women.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #106: Taiwan's LGBTQ History with Wen Liu
description: Scholar Wen Liu joins host Sophia Yan to trace Taiwan's LGBTQ movement from its post-martial law origins to the landmark 2019 same-sex marriage ruling, examining the activists who drove change and the challenges still ahead.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #107: Pearl Low on their platform, Cantonese Connection, and heritage language learning
description: Pearl Low discusses founding Cantonese Connection, a welcoming platform for heritage language learners, and opens up about the cultural pressures and challenges of reclaiming a family language.

title: NüVoices Podcast x Ghost Island Media Panel:  Covering Taiwan, Centering Local Perspectives, with Silva Shih, Afore Hsieh, Wen-Yee Lee, and Emily Y. Wu
description: Host Emily Y. Wu and Taipei-based journalists Silva Shih, Afore Hsieh, and Wen-Yee Lee explore the vital role of local reporting as unprecedented global media attention converges on Taiwan.

title: NüProfile: Fiona Sze-Lorrain on creativity and her debut novel "Dear Chrysanthemums"
description: Fiona Sze-Lorrain discusses creativity, writing, and the themes of her Carnegie Medal-longlisted debut novel "Dear Chrysanthemums," a collection of interconnected stories exploring the lives of Chinese and Asian women across five cities.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #108: #MeToo in Taiwan, a Conversation with Darice Chang and Rita Jhang
description: Activists Darice Chang and Rita Jhang examine Taiwan's #MeToo wave, tracing its origins and exploring its complex intersections with feminism, identity, and the island's electoral politics.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #109: 'How to Have an American Baby' with documentary filmmaker Leslie Tai
description: Host Solarina Ho speaks with filmmaker Leslie Tai about her documentary "How to Have an American Baby," exploring the shadow economy of birth tourism and the complex lives of Chinese mothers seeking U.S. citizenship for their newborns.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #110: Feminist Activism Then & Now, a Conversation with Wanqing Zhang, Lijia Zhang & Jessie Lau
description: Three writers explore China's evolving digital feminist movement, from grassroots resistance on platforms like Xiaohongshu to the ongoing crackdowns on gender activism at home and abroad.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #111: A Conversation with Fuchsia Dunlop about her book, "Invitation to a Banquet"
description: Award-winning food writer Fuchsia Dunlop joins host Lijia Zhang to discuss her latest book, "Invitation to a Banquet," a sweeping exploration of Chinese culinary culture spanning millennia of history, tradition, and everyday life.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #112: Leta Hong Fincher on the 10th Anniversary Edition of her book, Leftover Women
description: Leta Hong Fincher joins host Jessie Lau to discuss the 10th anniversary edition of her seminal work Leftover Women, exploring why China's patriarchal pressures on unmarried women are more urgent than ever.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #113: Illustrator Kaitlin Chan on her graphic novel, 'Eric's Sister'
description: Cartoonist Kaitlin Chan discusses her Hong Kong-set graphic novel "Eric's Sister," exploring sibling dynamics, creative doubt, and the pressures first-generation college students face when pursuing careers in the arts.

title: NüVoices in Perugia: The rise and transformation of women's magazines and platforms
description: At the International Journalism Festival in Perugia, NüVoices Editor Jessie Lau joined leaders from Teen Vogue and gal-dem to explore how young women's media platforms have transformed into powerful vehicles for social activism and marginalized voices.

title: NüVoices Podcast #114: Indigenous culture, politics and activism in Taiwan, a Conversation with Tuhi Martukaw
description: Solarina Ho speaks with Indigenous policy advocate and journalist Tuhi Martukaw about what it means to be Indigenous in Taiwan, exploring reconciliation, activism, and the communities' complex relationship with settler politics.

title: NüVoices Podcast #115: UBC Students Podcast Special! Yi Chien Jade Ho on Anti-Gentrification Activism in Vancouver's Chinatown and Judith Shapiro on Environmentalism in China
description: UBC students explore anti-gentrification activism in Vancouver's Chinatown with postdoctoral fellow Yi Chien Jade Ho and discuss environmentalism in China with Judith Shapiro in this special collaborative podcast episode.

title: Book excerpt: Kate Whitehead's 'Pandemic Minds' explores mental health in Hong Kong
description: Journalist and psychotherapist Kate Whitehead draws on 40 in-depth interviews to reveal the hidden mental health toll of Hong Kong's strict pandemic measures, weaving personal testimony into a guide for collective recovery.

title: NüVoices 2024 Global Updates / Wrap
description: The NüVoices team recaps a productive 2024, highlighting new podcast episodes, magazine commissions, a journalism conference appearance in Perugia, and a transparent breakdown of how donor contributions fuel its all-volunteer mission.

title: Past, present and poetry: Hong Kong filmmaker Ann Hui’s 'July Rhapsody'
description: Daisy Singh Greaves examines how Ann Hui's tender midlife drama weaves Chinese classical poetry into one man's reckoning with regret, desire, and the weight of roads not taken.

title: Fiction: A Long Walk Through the Tall Dry Grass
